title: Development of Digital Behavioral Health Interventions: Human-Centered Design-Based Projects at Scale

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in using basic digital tools and foundational understanding of health behavior change theories
context.additional_context: Learners experience the digital health intervention design process through real-world cases, with a focus on team-based project execution and feedback incorporation

learning_goals: Learners can develop a digital behavioral health intervention prototype by applying the human-centered design (HCD) process.
Learners can analyze target group needs through user research (interviews/observation) and incorporate them into intervention design.
Learners can refine intervention strategies to increase user engagement through feedback collection and iterative prototyping.

resources: Digital Prototyping Tools (e.g., Figma), Survey Platforms, SMS Simulation Tools

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
